author: SteveL-MSFT
body: We [published the assembly](https://www.nuget.org/packages/PowerShellStandard.Library/3.0.0-preview-01), but don't have a simple sample the community can build on to produce a module

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT  "hell*p*"? Why not start with hells "a" through "o"? 😜

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @mklement0 I think it was a Freudian slip to `Help World` given current state of things

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: FYI, I'm going to create a PR probably later tonight that does a similar walk-through using the dotnet CLI from the WSL console.   The doc is done except that I was waiting on a determination of whether or not .NET 4.7.1 fixes the issue with loading a .NET Standard 2.0 based binary module into Windows PowerShell.  AFAICT it does!!  Just tried it this morning on Windows 10 FCU (16299.15) which seems to come with .NET 4.7.1 (or at least a version of .NET that is newer than 4.7).

title: Publish sample for portable 'hello world' module using PS Std 3.0
